message: I know that YC allows startups to defer for a cycle. The obvious reason is that you have time to quit your job, etc. But is it also a good reason for MVP-stage startups to get large amounts of coding out of the way so you can spend more time networking and company building, or is this just a cop out to avoid diving in head first to lean startup iteration?
it all depends on how busy you are and how good you feel about your plan

Do they allow deferring? I haven't heard of any companies that have done that. But then again we've never asked about it. You find out your accepted almost two months before the batch officially starts; in practice that's been enough time to not just quite your job but move to another continent.
personally, I'm not aware of any companies having "deferred" to a later term
in a nutshell – the longer you put off applying for YC, the longer it'll take for you to potentially reap the benefits should you be accepted
I've chatted with a few YC alumni over the last year and I've yet to hear of anyone deferring.
only for my interest... can someone explain what "YC" means?
But @jamtoday, that doesn't sound like a good reason
@jamtoday we got TONS of development done on AdGrok during our batch -- PG will help you most pre-MVP, arguably.
